title: Miranda Kerr and Evan Speigel are ‘overjoyed’ at birth of baby boy
text:
Mirand Kerr and Evan Spiegel confirmed the birth of their second son (Picture: PA Images)

Miranda Kerr and Evan Spiegel have welcomed their second child, and the couple gushed about how ‘overjoyed’ they were with their new arrival.

Victoria’s Secret model Miranda, 36, and Snapchat founder Evan, 29, released a statement confirming the birth of their son and revealed they had named the baby Myles.

Alongside a photo of a personalised baby blanket with Myles’s name on it, Miranda wrote: ‘We are overjoyed at the arrival of Myles and so appreciate everyone’s kind words and wishes during this special time.

‘We couldn’t be more excited to welcome our beautiful son into our family.’

Myles is the couple’s second son, and they also share 17-month-old Hart. Miranda also has another son, Flynn, eight, with ex-husband Orlando Bloom.

Miranda has been with her billionaire tech entrepreneur beau since 2015, and the couple married in 2017.

The couple had announced they were expecting their second baby in March, but the model remained tight-lipped about the gender, revealing the couple knew ‘the sex and we have names but it’s nice to keep a little to yourself.’

While they weren’t going to reveal any details about their baby until he was born, Miranda did share several photos of her growing bump on social media to keep her fans updated.

Miranda also previously revealed she struggled through pregnancy, explaining: ‘I suffered quite a lot of morning sickness and I was on bed rest for a little while, then I pinched a nerve in my neck.

‘Every woman is different. For some reason… with each three of my pregnancies, I’ve been super nauseous and a little more sensitive.

‘I’ve had morning sickness with all of them. With Flynn I had it, with Hart I had it, and now I have it again. Hopefully it will dissipate.

‘It helps when I’m constantly snacking. I’ve just had a ginger apple shot. Ginger tea helps. Fresh ginger and hot water with a little honey and lemon.’
